study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of hand reflexology on anxiety levels in coronary angiography patients.
results_summary: Hand reflexology significantly reduced anxiety levels in coronary angiography patients compared to simple hand massage, with statistically significant differences observed at multiple time points post-intervention.
population_specificity: Coronary angiography patients (n=80, >6 months eligibility).
study_duration: Measurements taken before (T0), 30 min (T1), and 1 hour (T2) after intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the addition of manual soft tissue massage (as part of a combined treatment) improved back pain and function compared to orthotics alone or no treatment.
results_summary: The study found that the group receiving orthotics plus chiropractic care (including massage) showed significantly greater functional improvement compared to orthotics alone, but no significant difference in pain relief. Massage was part of a multimodal intervention, making its isolated effects unclear.
population_specificity: Adult subjects (N=225) with chronic low back pain (≥3 months).
effective_dosage: Not specified (manual soft tissue massage was part of a combined intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of aromatherapy and acupressure massage on improving sleep quality and quality of life in career women.
results_summary: Acupressure massage significantly improved sleep quality and quality of life, with greater improvements in sleep quality compared to lavender essential oil. The blended essential oil group showed the most significant dual benefits in both sleep quality and quality of life.
population_specificity: Career women aged 24-55 years.
effective_dosage: Not specified for massage; essential oils were used in a 1:1:1 ratio (Lavandula angustifolia, Salvia sclarea, Origanum majorana).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a 10-day intensive health promotion program, including massage, on body composition, physical fitness, and biochemical parameters in young adults.
results_summary: The program, which included massage practice, significantly improved physical fitness (e.g., muscle strength, flexibility, balance) and metabolic health (e.g., reduced blood glucose, cholesterol levels).
population_specificity: 30 female undergraduate students

study_goal: To determine the effects of enteral feeding improvement massage on feeding, growth, and superior mesentery artery blood flow in premature infants.
results_summary: The experimental group achieved full enteral feeding faster, had higher superior mesentery artery peak velocity, and showed faster growth compared to the control group. The study concluded that the massage intervention was beneficial for feeding-intolerant premature infants.
population_specificity: Premature infants born at <34 weeks of gestational age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a rare case of radial nerve neuropathy caused by deep tissue massage and highlight the need for awareness of such injuries.
results_summary: The study documented a case of radial nerve neuropathy at the spiral groove following a single deep tissue massage session, with near-total recovery after 6 months. Electrodiagnostic and ultrasound examinations confirmed the lesion location and prognosis.
population_specificity: 58-year-old woman
effective_dosage: Single episode of deep tissue massage

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of acupuncture with other interventions, including massage, in reducing headache frequency in adults with tension-type headaches.
results_summary: The study found no significant superiority of acupuncture over massage, with some outcomes slightly favoring massage. Adverse effects and dropouts related to massage were not reported.
population_specificity: Adults with episodic or chronic tension-type headaches.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of manual therapy (including neurodynamic techniques, functional massage, and carpal bone mobilizations) with electrophysical modalities (laser and ultrasound therapy) in treating mild and moderate carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS).
results_summary: Manual therapy (MT) showed significant improvements in median nerve sensory and motor conduction velocities, pain reduction, symptom severity, and functional status compared to electrophysical modalities (EM). Both therapies had positive effects, but MT demonstrated superior outcomes in pain reduction, subjective symptoms, and functional status.
population_specificity: 140 patients with mild and moderate carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a pelvic floor training program, including perineal massage and exercises, on reducing perineal trauma during childbirth in primiparous women.
results_summary: The study found that the intervention significantly reduced episiotomy rates (31.63% reduction), increased the likelihood of an intact perineum, and decreased severe perineal tears and postpartum pain compared to standard care.
population_specificity: Primiparous women at 32 weeks of pregnancy with singleton pregnancies anticipating normal birth.
effective_dosage: Daily perineal massage and pelvic floor exercises.
study_duration: From 32 weeks of pregnancy until birth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of manual lymphatic drainage (MLD) on blood flow velocity in women with post-axillary lymphadenectomy lymphedema after breast cancer surgery.
results_summary: MLD with upper limb elevation significantly increased brachial vein blood flow velocity immediately after the procedure, but the effect was temporary, returning to baseline after 30 minutes. No significant effect was observed without limb elevation.
population_specificity: Women (mean age 64 ± 11.44 years) with post-axillary lymphadenectomy lymphedema following breast cancer surgery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (MLD procedure described, but exact duration/frequency per session not detailed).
study_duration: Single session with measurements taken before, immediately after, and 30 minutes post-MLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of massage therapy (MT), multisensory environment (MSE), and their combined use on reducing challenging behaviors in individuals with intellectual disabilities.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in challenging behaviors between groups, but participants in the MT and MSE groups showed a shift to an inactive state ("passive alertness"), suggesting relaxation effects. The combined MT in MSE group exhibited the most pronounced inactive state.
population_specificity: Residents with intellectual disabilities in a long-term care facility (17 men and 25 women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate the effectiveness of massage and touch on the behavioural and psychological symptoms of older people with dementia.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed significant reductions in behavioural and psychological problems, including physical and verbal aggressive/non-aggressive behaviours, but no significant improvements in anxiety, sadness, or anger. The study noted limitations due to small sample sizes and low-quality included studies.
population_specificity: Older people with dementia (526 participants across 11 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if abdominal massage is an effective and cost-effective treatment for neurogenic bowel dysfunction (constipation) in people with multiple sclerosis (MS).
results_summary: The study is a pragmatic randomized controlled trial comparing abdominal massage to no massage, with primary outcomes measured at 24 weeks. The abstract suggests feasibility but does not report final efficacy results, leaving effectiveness uncertain pending trial completion.
population_specificity: Adults with MS who report bothersome constipation.
effective_dosage: Once daily abdominal massage for 6 weeks.
study_duration: 6 weeks of intervention, with outcomes measured at 24 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the prevalence, profiles, motivations, and self-reported effectiveness of manual therapy use among individuals with headache disorders.
results_summary: Manual therapy appears to be the most common non-medical treatment for recurrent headaches, primarily sought for pain relief. Many patients continue concurrent medical care, but around half may not disclose manual therapy use to their doctors.
population_specificity: Individuals with common recurrent headache disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of feet reflexology and segmental massage on reducing pain, intensity, frequency, and duration of migraine attacks in female patients.
results_summary: Both feet reflexology and segmental massage significantly reduced pain, intensity, frequency, and duration of migraine attacks, with statistically significant differences observed within and between groups. Feet reflexology showed notable benefits for migraine patients.
population_specificity: Females aged 33-58 suffering from migraine for 2 to 10 years.
effective_dosage: Reflexology group: 10 treatments, 2 times per week; Segmental massage group: 15 treatments, 3 times per week.
study_duration: Treatment duration varied by group (reflexology: 5 weeks; segmental massage: 5 weeks).

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically investigate massage but mentions it as a nonpharmacologic option for labor pain management.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on massage, only noting it as a potential adjunct or alternative for labor pain relief.
population_specificity: Women in labor (general mention, no specific population studied).

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically study massage but mentions it as a nonpharmacologic option for labor pain management.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on massage, only noting it as a potential adjunct or alternative for labor pain relief.
population_specificity: Women in labor (general mention, no specific demographic details).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and feasibility of massage therapy for chronic low back pain in a real-world primary care setting.
results_summary: Massage therapy improved pain, disability, and health-related quality of life at 12 weeks, with sustained benefits for some outcomes at 24 weeks. Older adults (over 49 years) showed better pain and disability outcomes than younger adults.
population_specificity: Primary care patients with chronic low back pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether micro-physiotherapy could reduce the severity of IBS symptoms compared to a sham procedure.
results_summary: Micro-physiotherapy significantly improved IBS symptoms in 74% of patients after the first session, compared to 38% in the sham group, with sustained effects after the second session. The difference between groups remained statistically significant.
population_specificity: 61 recurrent IBS patients (mean age 53.5±15.3 years) with symptoms like abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, or bloating, excluding those with major intestinal surgery or chronic diseases.
effective_dosage: Two sessions of micro-physiotherapy (micro-palpatory examination followed by micro-massage).
study_duration: Intervention spanned two sessions, with follow-up at 1 month.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the success rate of different treatment modalities, including sac massage, for pediatric epiphora and compare outcomes between early-onset and late-onset groups.
results_summary: The study found an 82% success rate for sac massage in treating pediatric epiphora, with no significant association between treatment outcome and the modality used. Factors like laterality, infection, symptom severity, and previous treatment history were predictive of outcomes.
population_specificity: Children aged <10 years presenting with epiphora at a tertiary eye care center (167 patients, 209 eyes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of massage therapy as a sleep intervention for children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy was among the alternative therapies considered, but no single intervention, including massage, was effective across all sleep problems in children with ASD. Behavioral interventions, melatonin, and parent education programs appeared more effective than alternative therapies like massage.
population_specificity: Children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) experiencing sleep problems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify predictors of improved self-reported function in patients with chronic ankle instability (CAI) following plantar massage (PM) and other sensory-targeted interventions.
results_summary: Patients under 22 years old with limited dorsiflexion and balance deficits had a 99% probability of meaningful improvement in sport-related function after PM. Those with ≥2 single-limb-stance errors also showed a 98% probability of improvement.
population_specificity: Fifty-nine patients with chronic ankle instability (CAI), as defined by International Ankle Consortium recommendations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence and nature of alternative therapy (AT) use, including massage, among pediatric ED patients and parent perceptions of ATs.
results_summary: Massage was the most common AT used (16% of patients), primarily for musculoskeletal problems, health maintenance, stress, and anxiety. Parents who arranged ATs perceived them as safe and beneficial, though the study did not specifically evaluate massage's efficacy.
population_specificity: Pediatric emergency department patients in metropolitan Melbourne, Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different roller massage forces (sham, moderate, high) on range of motion, strength, and jump performance in healthy individuals.
results_summary: The study found that roller massage increased active and passive range of motion (7.0% and 15.4%, respectively) without impairing strength or jump performance, regardless of the applied force. No significant changes were observed in drop jump or maximum voluntary isometric contraction parameters.
population_specificity: Sixteen healthy individuals (27 ± 4 years).
effective_dosage: Three 60-second quadriceps roller massage bouts with varying pain conditions (RMlow: 3.9/10 RPP, RMmod: 6.2/10 RPP, RMhigh: 8.2/10 RPP).
study_duration: Single session with pre- and post-measurements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of single and multiple massage treatments on pressure-pain threshold (PPT) at myofascial trigger points (MTrPs) in individuals with myofascial pain syndrome expressed as tension-type headache.
results_summary: Massage significantly increased PPT at MTrPs in all tested muscle sites, with immediate, cumulative, and sustained effects observed. No such improvements were seen in sham ultrasound or wait-list control groups.
population_specificity: Individuals (n = 62) with episodic or chronic tension-type headache.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of mechanical stimulus frequency on skin tissue response and whether massage could amplify the anti-aging effects of a topical cream.
results_summary: Massage at 75Hz increased expression of dermal proteins (decorin, fibrillin, tropoelastin, and procollagen-1) in ex vivo skin explants. In vivo, combining massage with an anti-aging cream enhanced the cream's beneficial effects on facial wrinkles, skin texture, and neck sagging compared to cream alone.
population_specificity: Ex vivo skin explants and 42 Caucasian women aged 65-75 years.
effective_dosage: Twice daily for one minute at 65-85Hz (ex vivo); daily massage with device (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether aromatherapy massage with lavender essential oil could reduce anxiety in ICU patients undergoing mechanical ventilation.
results_summary: The aromatherapy group showed significantly better anxiety scores (VAS-A) and lower heart rate compared to the control group, with effects lasting at least 30 minutes, though music intervention had greater overall efficacy.
population_specificity: ICU patients undergoing mechanical ventilation with admission duration >24 hours.
effective_dosage: Lavender essential oil massage on the back for 5 minutes.
study_duration: Single 5-minute session with follow-up measurements at 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review and evaluate studies on the effects of therapeutic massage on preterm neonates in the NICU, assessing methodological quality and summarizing outcomes.
results_summary: Most studies reported beneficial effects of therapeutic massage on preterm infants, including improved growth, neurodevelopment, brain development, reduced sepsis risk, shorter hospital stays, and lower neonatal stress. The review suggested clear benefits, encouraging broader use in NICU practice.
population_specificity: Preterm neonates in the NICU.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the prevalence and perceived benefits of CAM use, including massage, among children with pain conditions in the U.S.
results_summary: The study found that 21.3% of children with pain conditions used CAM, with many parents reporting benefits for their child's symptoms. CAM use was significantly higher in children with pain compared to those without (8.1%).
population_specificity: Children aged 4 to 17 years in the U.S. with pain conditions (e.g., headache, abdominal, musculoskeletal pain).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage as a nonpharmacologic therapy for chronic low back pain.
results_summary: The study found that massage is effective for chronic low back pain, with a low to moderate strength of evidence. The benefits were generally small to moderate in magnitude and short-term, with effects on function being smaller than those on pain.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic nonradicular or radicular low back pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the efficacy of cupping massage in reducing neck pain and improving function and quality of life in patients with chronic non-specific neck pain.
results_summary: Cupping massage significantly reduced neck pain, improved pain on movement, functional disability, and quality of life, with some changes in pressure pain sensitivity. Five adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic non-specific neck pain (mean age 52.6 ± 10.3 years, 92% female).
effective_dosage: 5 cupping massages on a twice-weekly basis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the methodological quality and evidence quality of systematic reviews and meta-analyses on traditional Chinese medical nursing interventions, including massage.
results_summary: The study found that systematic reviews/meta-analyses of TCMN interventions, including massage, were of medium methodological quality, with evidence quality ranging from very low to moderate. No high-quality evidence was identified, and concerns were raised about risk of bias and inconsistency in the findings.
population_specificity: Not specified (systematic reviews and meta-analyses of TCMN interventions in Chinese journals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically appraise and synthesize evidence on the effects of massage therapy as a stand-alone treatment for pain and functional outcomes in individuals with osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: The review found low- to moderate-quality evidence that massage therapy is superior to nonactive therapies in reducing pain and improving certain functional outcomes, but its effectiveness compared to other treatments remains unclear.
population_specificity: Individuals with osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis (352 participants across seven randomized controlled trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of physiotherapy (including massage) versus splint therapy for treating myogenous temporomandibular disorders (TMD).
results_summary: Physiotherapy showed similar success rates and effectiveness as splint therapy (51-60% long-term success rate), with a shorter treatment duration (10.4 weeks less on average). Cohen's d for pain intensity was 0.86 for physiotherapy, indicating a large effect size.
population_specificity: 72 patients with myogenous temporomandibular disorders (TMD).
effective_dosage: Not specified (massage was part of a broader physiotherapy intervention).
study_duration: Intended treatment duration was between 10-21 weeks for physiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize data on the epidemiology, etiology, and management of growing pains, including the role of massage as a symptomatic treatment.
results_summary: The study found that massage, along with over-the-counter analgesics, is part of the symptomatic care recommended for managing growing pains, which are benign and self-limited. No adverse effects or specific efficacy metrics for massage were detailed.
population_specificity: Young children with growing pains (bilateral lower extremity pain, typically occurring in the evening or at night).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of two foot massage methods (classical massage and reflexology) on symptom control in colorectal cancer patients undergoing chemoradiotherapy.
results_summary: Classical foot massage reduced pain and distension incidence, while reflexology reduced pain, fatigue, distension, urinary frequency, and improved quality of life. Both interventions showed positive effects compared to standard care.
population_specificity: 60 participants with colorectal cancer receiving chemoradiotherapy.
effective_dosage: Twice a week for both classical massage and reflexology.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of massage, alone and combined with music, on pain intensity, anxiety intensity, and relaxation level in burn patients.
results_summary: The study found that massage, both alone and combined with music, significantly reduced pain and anxiety intensity while increasing relaxation levels compared to the control group, with no significant difference between the interventions.
population_specificity: Burn patients admitted to Shahid Motahari Burns Hospital in Tehran, Iran.
effective_dosage: Swedish massage for 20 minutes once a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate short-term changes in passive hip flexion and extension after foam rolling and roller massage durations of 60 and 120 seconds.
results_summary: The study examined the effects of foam rolling and roller massage on hip range of motion, but the abstract does not provide specific results regarding the magnitude or significance of changes.
population_specificity: Ten recreationally active men (27.6 ± 2.4 years old).
effective_dosage: 60s and 120s durations for foam rolling and roller massage.

study_goal: To determine whether clinical massage could reduce pain and anxiety and improve sleep in progressive care unit patients.
results_summary: The massage intervention showed an immediate and significant reduction in self-reported pain and anxiety (P < .001).
population_specificity: 288 inpatients in a progressive care unit.
study_duration: Daily intervention (exact study duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of pharmacological treatments, including tuina massage, for antipsychotic-related constipation.
results_summary: The study found that tuina massage was more effective than glycerol suppositories in relieving constipation at two and three days post-treatment, though the evidence was of very low quality. No adverse events or safety data for massage were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with antipsychotic-related constipation, specifically those taking clozapine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of acupressure on specific acupoints versus non-specific acupoints in improving sleep quality and quality of life among older nursing home residents with sleep disturbances.
results_summary: The experimental group receiving acupressure on specific acupoints showed significantly better improvements in sleep quality (PSQI) and quality of life (SF-36) compared to the control group, with sustained benefits observed even after adjusting for confounding variables.
population_specificity: Older nursing home residents in Taiwan with sleep disturbances.
effective_dosage: Acupressure was administered three times a week for 24 minutes per session.
study_duration: 8 weeks of intervention, with follow-up measurements 4 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of psychosocial interventions, including massage, on pain and function in children with rheumatic diseases.
results_summary: One study compared psychosocial interventions to massage in children with juvenile arthritis and found no significant improvements in pain scores. No significant differences in functional outcomes were reported.
population_specificity: Children aged 5-18 years with rheumatic diseases (fibromyalgia or juvenile arthritis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence of Chlamydia, mycoplasma, and trichomonas infections in patients previously diagnosed with chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome using prostatic massage samples.
results_summary: The study found that 13.8% of patients had positive expressed prostatic secretions/VB3 samples, with 10.1% harboring sexually transmitted organisms not detected in previous tests. This suggests prostatic massage can identify pathogens missed by standard diagnostic methods.
population_specificity: 254 patients previously diagnosed and treated for chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome with negative urethral swab, urine, and prostate samples.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to improve the management of perineal pain among postpartum women through evidence-based practices, including perineal massage.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in compliance with perineal pain management practices, including a 97% increase in education regarding antenatal perineal massage technique and a 70% increase in women's acceptance of postnatal perineal care education.
population_specificity: Postpartum women in Ward 21 of the Obstetric and Gynecological Hospital, Fudan University.

study_goal: To determine the effect of deep cross-friction massage on spasticity in children with cerebral palsy.
results_summary: The experimental group showed significant improvement in spasticity compared to baseline values but not compared to the control group. Functional level did not improve by the end of the study.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with spastic diplegic cerebral palsy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the flow resistance and vocal fold massage effects of Resonance tube (RT) and Lax Vox tube (LVT) under different immersion conditions.
results_summary: LVT showed slightly lower flow resistance than RT, with higher oral pressure oscillation at 2 cm immersion, suggesting a stronger massage effect on vocal folds. Preferences between tubes varied among subjects.
population_specificity: 14 subjects (specific demographics not provided).
effective_dosage: Not specified (subjects phonated in habitual loudness and loudly under set conditions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of brief mental health and well-being interventions, including massage, in organizational settings compared to longer-duration interventions.
results_summary: The study found no evidence supporting the effectiveness of brief massage interventions for mental health and well-being in workplace settings. The majority of studies on brief interventions had a high risk of bias.
population_specificity: Employees in organizational (workplace) settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical influence of prostatic stones on lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS), seminal plasma cytokines, and serum biomarkers, including the effects of prostate massage.
results_summary: The study found that subjects with prostatic stones had more severe LUTS, higher chronic prostatitis symptoms, lower urinary flow rates, reduced f/t PSA ratio, and increased seminal concentrations of IL-1β and IL-8 compared to those without stones. Prostate massage was used as part of the diagnostic and assessment process.
population_specificity: 70 men aged ≤50 years with LUTS, divided into groups with and without prostatic stones.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of vagal manoeuvres (including massage) versus adenosine for terminating supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) in children.
results_summary: The study found that carotid sinus massage is less effective than ice water to the face and adenosine for terminating SVT in children. Ice water to the face was deemed safe, quick, and effective, while adenosine was also safe and effective but more invasive.
population_specificity: Children with supraventricular tachycardia (SVT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of moderate pressure massage on upper trapezius muscle activity compared to quiet sitting.
results_summary: The study found that short-duration moderate pressure massage significantly reduced upper trapezius muscle activity by 19.3% (P=0.004), whereas quiet sitting resulted in only a 1.0% reduction. The findings suggest massage may benefit clinical populations with chronic neck pain.
population_specificity: Seventeen healthy individuals (nine women; mean age 24.5±4.0 years).
effective_dosage: Moderate pressure massage applied to the shoulders and neck (specific duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the immediate effects of myofascial induction (MI) versus placebo electrotherapy on pain, range of motion, and mood in breast cancer survivors with shoulder/arm morbidity.
results_summary: A single MI session significantly reduced pain in the affected arm and improved shoulder and cervical range of motion compared to placebo, but did not significantly affect pain in other areas or anxiety.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors (stage I-IIIA) who had completed adjuvant therapy (except hormonal treatment).
study_duration: Single session with a 4-week washout period between interventions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether upper limb massage could effectively reduce pain in infants undergoing venipuncture.
results_summary: The study found that infants who received massage had significantly lower pain scores compared to those receiving usual care, with no significant time or carryover effects observed. The results were statistically significant and clinically relevant.
population_specificity: Infants in the neonatal intensive care unit in Hong Kong.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the quality and consistency of clinical practice guidelines for hypertension in Chinese medicine, including the role of massage in treatment.
results_summary: The study found that massage was recommended for Grade I and Grade II hypertension with severe symptoms affecting quality of life, suggesting its efficacy in symptom management. The evidence-based guideline supported its use, though specific efficacy data were not detailed.
population_specificity: Hypertension patients, specifically Grade I and Grade II with severe symptoms impacting quality of life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of aerobic exercise and self-myofascial release (massage) on cognitive performance and investigate whether physiological factors like lactate mediate these effects.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in cognitive performance between aerobic exercise groups and the self-myofascial release control group, suggesting that physiological effects alone may not explain cognitive facilitation. Peripheral lactate levels showed no significant association with cognitive outcomes.
population_specificity: 121 healthy young adults
effective_dosage: 35-minute instructed self-massage intervention using a foam roll

study_goal: To determine the efficacy of massage therapy in reducing pain and fatigue in people with chronic spinal cord injury.
results_summary: Massage therapy significantly reduced chronic pain and fatigue after 5 weeks, with large effect sizes. Guided imagery was equally effective as massage in reducing pain and fatigue.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic spinal cord injury living in the community.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes once a week for 5 consecutive weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage, both alone and combined with reiki, in reducing stress and anxiety in clients at a therapy institute in Brazil.
results_summary: Massage + Reiki (G2) showed a 33% reduction in stress and a 21% reduction in anxiety, while Massage + Rest (G1) showed a 24% reduction in stress and a 16% reduction in anxiety, both compared to the control group. The results were statistically significant, with moderate to large effect sizes (Cohen's d 0.78–1.18).
population_specificity: Clients at the Institute for Integrated and Oriental Therapy in Sao Paulo, Brazil (initial sample of 122 people).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of aromatherapy massage with lavender essential oil on pain relief in patients with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Aromatherapy massage with lavender essential oil significantly reduced pain immediately and 1 week after the intervention compared to baseline and the control group, but no significant difference was observed 4 weeks post-intervention.
population_specificity: 90 patients with knee osteoarthritis from outpatient rheumatology clinics.
study_duration: Evaluated immediately, 1 week, and 4 weeks post-intervention (exact massage duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if physiotherapist-led cognitive-behavioural interventions are more effective than traditional biomedical treatments (including massage) for low back pain and whether these interventions are described sufficiently for replication.
results_summary: The study found that cognitive-behavioural interventions had greater effects on reducing disability and pain compared to traditional treatments like massage, but details on intervention content and procedural information were lacking. Massage was noted to provide short-term benefits, but sustained effects were questionable.
population_specificity: Patients with low back pain treated by physiotherapists.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure physiotherapists' adherence to guideline recommendations for knee osteoarthritis management, including the use of massage as a treatment modality.
results_summary: The study found that 49% of physiotherapists applied massage, despite it being identified as a treatment modality that does not contribute to high-quality care for knee osteoarthritis. Compliance with quality indicators for massage was not specifically detailed, but its frequent use suggests limited efficacy in guideline-recommended care.
population_specificity: Belgian physiotherapists treating patients with knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage as part of multimodal care for persistent neck pain and whiplash-associated disorders.
results_summary: The study suggests high-dose massage as an effective treatment for persistent neck pain (grades I-II NAD) when combined with other interventions like supervised exercise and advice. It supports massage as part of multimodal care for improving outcomes in persistent neck pain.
population_specificity: Adults with persistent (>3 months) neck pain, including grades I-III neck pain-associated disorders (NADs) and whiplash-associated disorders (WADs).
effective_dosage: High-dose massage (specific amount and frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify predictors of successful improvement in postural control for chronic ankle instability participants receiving plantar massage, ankle joint mobilization, or calf stretching.
results_summary: Participants with a self-reported function limb difference <16.07% and >2.5 balance test errors had a 99% probability of treatment success following plantar massage. The study identified specific characteristics (functional deficits, balance errors, and previous sprains) that predict treatment success.
population_specificity: Fifty-nine participants with chronic ankle instability (history of ≥2 "giving way" episodes in 6 months and functional limitations).
effective_dosage: 6 sessions of 5-minute plantar massage over 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of HIV/STI intervention programs targeting female entertainment workers (FEWs), including those in massage parlors.
results_summary: The study found that FEWs in the intervention group were significantly more likely to report condom use with paying partners but not with regular partners. Most studies employed behavioral strategies, and structural interventions were less common.
population_specificity: Female entertainment workers (FEWs) in karaoke lounges, bars, pubs, nightclubs, discotheques, dance halls, massage parlors, restaurants, and beer gardens.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of massage and other integrative therapies in reducing tissue stiffness, improving mobility, and their possible effects on cancer progression and metastasis.
results_summary: The study suggests that massage and similar therapies may reduce connective tissue inflammation and fibrosis, potentially impacting tumor growth and metastasis, but acknowledges a lack of knowledge about risks associated with mechanical forces near tumors.
population_specificity: Cancer patients using complementary and integrative treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of breastfeeding versus massage (among other interventions) in reducing procedural pain in infants aged 28 days to 12 months.
results_summary: Breastfeeding was more effective than massage in reducing crying duration and pain scores during vaccination. No adverse events were reported for massage, but its efficacy was inferior to breastfeeding.
population_specificity: Infants aged 28 days to 12 months undergoing vaccination.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of GOAT as a potential biomarker for prostate cancer (PCa) and its correlation with metabolic conditions, including its detection in urine samples post-massage.
results_summary: The study found that GOAT levels were higher in urine samples after prostate massage compared to pre-massage, suggesting its potential as a non-invasive biomarker for PCa. GOAT levels also correlated with PCa aggressiveness and metabolic conditions like diabetes.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients (n=52 for tissues, n=85 for plasma/urine samples) and matched controls (healthy prostate tissues n=12, BMI-matched controls n=28).

study_goal: To evaluate whether post-treatment massage reduces the incidence of nodule formation after PLLA injections for facial lipoatrophy.
results_summary: No nodules were reported in either the massage or non-massage groups. Both groups showed significant improvements in facial lipoatrophy, with no statistical difference between them.
population_specificity: 20 subjects with facial lipoatrophy.
effective_dosage: 1 vial of PLLA per month for 3 months, diluted with 1 mL of 1% lidocaine and 7 mL of bacteriostatic water.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of non-pharmacological interventions, including therapeutic massage, in managing cancer-related fatigue and psychological stress in paediatric oncology patients.
results_summary: Among the nine studies reviewed, therapeutic massage was one of the interventions tested, and six studies overall showed statistical significance in reducing fatigue and/or stress levels. The abstract suggests that these interventions, including massage, may complement conventional treatment and improve symptoms.
population_specificity: Paediatric oncology patients (children with cancer)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of open chest cardiac massage (OCCM) versus closed chest compressions (CCC) in traumatic cardiac arrest (TCA) using ETCO2 as a surrogate for cardiac output.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in ETCO2 levels or rates of ROSC with OCCM compared to CCC, suggesting OCCM provides no benefit over CCC in TCA.
population_specificity: Patients presenting to a level 1 trauma center after traumatic cardiac arrest.
study_duration: 9-month enrollment period; intervention duration varied per patient.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether massage, when combined with standard medical therapy, improves pain and functional outcomes more than standard medical therapy alone in patients with nonchronic low back pain.
results_summary: The study did not identify any eligible trials evaluating massage therapy, so no conclusions could be drawn about its efficacy for nonchronic low back pain.
population_specificity: Patients with nonradicular low back pain of less than 12 weeks' duration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various treatments, including Thai foot massage, for neuropathic pain and sensory symptoms in diabetic peripheral neuropathy of the feet.
results_summary: The study found that Thai foot massage significantly improved diabetic peripheral neuropathy symptoms, alongside other treatments like α-lipoic acid and opioids. No significant improvements were noted with some other interventions, such as micronutrients and photon stimulation therapy.
population_specificity: People with diabetes mellitus and diabetic peripheral neuropathy of the feet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Ayurvedic massage for pain relief in patients with nonspecific chronic low back pain compared to standard thermal therapy.
results_summary: Ayurvedic massage significantly reduced mean back pain more than thermal therapy at week 2, with benefits also seen in pain-related bothersomeness and psychological well-being, though it did not improve function or disability in the short term. Both treatments were safe and well tolerated.
population_specificity: 64 patients (mean age 54.8 years; 49 women, 15 men) with chronic low back pain scoring >40 mm on a 100-mm VAS.
effective_dosage: 6 hours of Ayurvedic massage and external treatment over 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dry needling (DN) combined with water pressure massage on muscle force, endurance, and flexibility in elite youth soccer players.
results_summary: DN significantly improved muscular endurance of knee extensors and flexors, hip flexion range of motion, and reduced muscle injuries compared to placebo and control groups. The effects persisted for at least 4 weeks post-treatment.
population_specificity: Elite youth soccer players from a professional Bundesliga Club.
effective_dosage: Four weekly sessions of DN plus water pressure massage.
study_duration: 4 weeks of intervention, with follow-ups at 4 weeks and 5 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of connective tissue manipulation (CTM) and Kinesio Taping (KT) in treating pediatric chronic constipation.
results_summary: The study found that both CTM and KT significantly improved defecation frequency, duration, stool consistency, pain levels, and quality of life in children with chronic constipation, with no significant difference in efficacy between the two methods.
population_specificity: Forty children (ages ~8 years) diagnosed with chronic constipation based on Rome III criteria.

study_goal: To investigate the effects of traditional Thai massage (TTM) on electromyographic activity, muscle tension, and pain intensity in patients with upper back pain associated with myofascial trigger points.
results_summary: TTM significantly reduced EMG activity, muscle tension, and pain intensity compared to the control group, which showed no significant changes except for muscle tension. The TTM group demonstrated greater reductions in all measured parameters.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with upper back pain associated with myofascial trigger points.

study_goal: To evaluate the effects of soft tissue techniques and neural mobilization techniques on patients with frequent episodic or chronic tension-type headaches.
results_summary: Groups receiving soft tissue techniques, neural mobilization, or a combination showed increased pressure pain threshold, reduced pain frequency and intensity, and improved headache impact scores compared to placebo. The combination group (D) demonstrated the most significant improvements.
population_specificity: 97 patients (78 women, 19 men) diagnosed with frequent episodic or chronic tension-type headaches.
study_duration: Intervention effects were assessed immediately after treatment and at 15 and 30 days post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if combining balance training with sensory-targeted interventions (including plantar massage) improves outcomes more than balance training alone in patients with chronic ankle instability.
results_summary: The study found no significant group differences, but effect sizes and minimal detectable change scores favored the combined intervention (including massage), suggesting potential benefits for self-assessed disability and postural control. Both groups showed improvements in outcomes, which were retained at follow-up.
population_specificity: 24 participants with chronic ankle instability (age 21.3 ± 2.0 years).
effective_dosage: 5-minute plantar massage before each balance-training session (3 sessions per week).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether discontinuing or reducing vasoactive therapy could reduce syncope and presyncope recurrence in elderly patients with reflex vasodepressor syncope, without increasing cardiovascular or neurological risks.
results_summary: The study found that stopping/reducing vasoactive therapy significantly reduced syncope and presyncope recurrence (23% in the intervention group vs. 54% in the control group) and increased systolic blood pressure, with no major adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Elderly patients (mean age 74±11 years) with reflex vasodepressor syncope, confirmed by tilt testing or carotid sinus massage.
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention involved discontinuing/reducing existing vasoactive therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the qualitative experiences of participants receiving Swedish massage for osteoarthritis of the knee, focusing on stress reduction, quality of life, and accessibility.
results_summary: Participants reported relaxation effects, improved quality of life, and greater accessibility of massage therapy for osteoarthritis. Their qualitative responses aligned with quantitative improvements in standard osteoarthritis measures.
population_specificity: 18 adults with osteoarthritis of the knee who previously participated in a dose-finding clinical trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of aromatherapy massage versus inhalation aromatherapy on reducing anxiety and pain in burn patients.
results_summary: Aromatherapy massage and inhalation aromatherapy both significantly reduced anxiety and pain in burn patients compared to the control group, with aromatherapy massage showing a slightly greater reduction in pain scores.
population_specificity: Burn patients with burns covering less than 20% of their body.
effective_dosage: Massage for half an hour using a blend of lavender and almond oils.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of scar massage in preventing and treating hypertrophic scars, keloids, and striae distensae.
results_summary: For hypertrophic scar prevention, scar massage showed low efficacy, while for treatment of existing hypertrophic scars, it demonstrated high efficacy. No significant efficacy was found for striae distensae.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertrophic scars, keloids, or striae distensae.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of infant massage performed by mothers on very preterm infants, focusing on neurodevelopment, maternal mood, anxiety, and mother-infant attachment.
results_summary: The study found that infant massage in preterm infants showed positive effects on weight gain and reduced hospital stay, but evidence for improved neurodevelopment, attachment, or maternal mood was limited. The study aims to provide further insights into these outcomes through electrophysiological, neuroradiological, and clinical assessments.
population_specificity: Very preterm infants (28 to 32 weeks and 6 days gestational age) and their mothers, with a reference group of healthy term-born infants.
effective_dosage: Standardized massage therapy administered by the mother (specific frequency not detailed).
study_duration: From recruitment until term equivalent age (TEA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of massage therapy on quality of life, negative emotions, and disease-related symptoms among women with breast cancer.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy had a treatment effect for anxiety (MD=-0.50, 95% CI=-0.77 to -0.24), but other outcomes showed either ineffective or equivocal results.
population_specificity: Middle-aged women with breast cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine how defining CAM professions (including massage) by treatment modalities versus their full professional scope impacts policy.
results_summary: The study found that workforce policies, licensure, research, treatment guidelines, and health plan reimbursement all influence how massage and other CAM professions are recognized and practiced, with reimbursement policies being a major focus but not the only factor.
population_specificity: CAM practitioners (12) and health policymaker representatives (9).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of extracorporeal shock wave therapy (ESWT) on scar pain in burn patients who had undergone standard therapy, including burn rehabilitation massage therapy.
results_summary: ESWT significantly improved pain scores (NRS, pain threshold, Nirschl pain phase system) and Roles and Maudsley scores compared to the sham control group, demonstrating clinically meaningful pain reduction in burn scar patients. No significant improvement was observed in the control group.
population_specificity: Burn patients with scar pain despite standard therapy (medication, physical therapy, and burn rehabilitation massage therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of Chinese massage therapy (Tui Na) for reducing post-stroke spasticity.
results_summary: Tui Na significantly reduced spasticity in four muscle groups compared to placebo, with sustained improvements at three months, but showed no significant difference in motor function or daily living activities. No adverse reactions were reported.
population_specificity: 90 patients with post-stroke spasticity.
effective_dosage: 20-25 minutes per limb, once daily, five days per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of foot massage on anxiety and pain relief in patients after caesarean delivery.
results_summary: Foot massage significantly improved heart rate variability (HRV), reduced anxiety scores, and lowered pain intensity compared to the control group. Vital signs (respiratory rate, systolic and diastolic blood pressure) also improved in the study group.
population_specificity: Post-operative caesarean delivery patients (n=70).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of foot reflexology and back massage in improving sleep quality and reducing fatigue in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found statistically significant improvements in sleep quality and fatigue reduction after administering foot reflexology and back massage. Foot reflexology was more effective than back massage.
population_specificity: 105 hemodialysis patients from a private dialysis clinic.
effective_dosage: Foot reflexology and back massage administered two times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of foot reflexology on vasomotor complaints and quality of life in women during menopause.
results_summary: Foot reflexology significantly reduced hot flashes, sweats, and night sweats compared to nonspecific foot massage, and improved quality of life, particularly in the sexual domain. The control group showed no significant improvements in the sexual domain.
population_specificity: 120 women in the menopausal period

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of ice massage (IM) and cold-water immersion (CWI) in reducing tissue temperature and preventing delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS).
results_summary: Both IM and CWI significantly reduced lactate levels and lowered skin temperature compared to passive recovery, with IM being more effective for localized muscle fatigue and CWI for generalized muscle fatigue. DOMS discomfort was notably reduced in both treatment groups after 72 hours.
population_specificity: 36 subjects divided into three groups (IM, CWI, passive recovery).
effective_dosage: Not specified (methods described as IM and CWI treatments post-exercise).
study_duration: Immediate post-exercise intervention with follow-up at 30 minutes and 72 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of hand and foot massage on post-cesarean pain and anxiety in primiparous women.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in pain intensity and anxiety levels immediately and 90 minutes after massage, along with improvements in blood pressure and respiration rate. Breastfeeding frequency also increased significantly post-massage.
population_specificity: 156 primiparous women who underwent elective cesarean section.
effective_dosage: Not specified (hand and foot massage or foot massage only).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of manual therapies, including massage, for managing pregnancy-related low back and pelvic pain.
results_summary: Meta-analyses found manual therapies, including massage, had positive effects on pain intensity compared to usual care and relaxation but not compared to sham interventions. Acceptability did not differ between manual therapy and usual care or sham interventions.
population_specificity: Pregnant women of any age and at any time during the antenatal period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the accuracy of using anatomical landmarks to locate the carotid sinus for carotid sinus massage (CSM).
results_summary: The study found that anatomical landmarks underestimated the carotid sinus location by 1.5 ± 1.3 cm, with errors ranging from 4 cm below to 2 cm above the actual location. A moderate correlation (r = 0.371) was observed between ultrasound and anatomical landmark methods.
population_specificity: Consecutive patients (n = 20) recruited prospectively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the beneficial effects of massage therapy on various conditions and compare its efficacy to standard treatments or other active therapies.
results_summary: Massage therapy showed positive effects across multiple conditions, often outperforming control or comparison groups, potentially due to stimulation of pressure receptors enhancing vagal activity and reducing cortisol levels. However, methodological limitations and reliance on self-report measures were noted.
population_specificity: Prenatal depression, preterm infants, full-term infants, autism, skin conditions, pain syndromes (arthritis, fibromyalgia), hypertension, autoimmune conditions (asthma, multiple sclerosis), immune conditions (HIV, breast cancer), aging problems (Parkinson's, dementia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the acute effects of Swedish massage therapy (SMT) as a monotherapy for treating generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
results_summary: The study found that SMT significantly reduced Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS) scores compared to light touch control, with treatment differences becoming significant by week 3 and a notable effect size of -0.69 at week 6.
population_specificity: Adults with DSM-IV diagnosed GAD who were currently untreated.
effective_dosage: Twice-weekly sessions of Swedish massage therapy.

study_goal: The researchers sought to evaluate the influence of research designs (RCT vs. non-RCT) on reflexology study outcomes and determine whether psychometric or biometric measures were more likely to show significant results.
results_summary: The review found that psychometric measures were more likely to show significant outcomes than biometric measures, particularly when using a nonmassage control strategy. No association was found between study outcomes and the choice of RCT or non-RCT methods.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of 37 interventional studies from 2000-2014).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether using safety checklists (including fundal massage for postpartum hemorrhage) during simulated obstetric emergencies improved completion of critical actions.
results_summary: For postpartum hemorrhage, trends toward higher completion rates were noted for PPH stage assessment and fundal massage, though teams did not achieve 100% task completion. Participants were enthusiastic about using checklists in clinical emergencies.
population_specificity: Medical teams managing simulated obstetric emergencies (eclampsia and postpartum hemorrhage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the physical and psychological effects of Anma therapy (Japanese massage) in gynecologic cancer survivors, focusing on both immediate single-session effects and sustained effects over eight weeks.
results_summary: The study found that a single AMT session significantly reduced subjective physical complaints and urinary epinephrine levels, indicating potential inhibition of the sympathetic nervous system. Weekly AMT sessions over eight weeks continued to reduce physical complaint severity, demonstrating sustained efficacy.
population_specificity: Gynecologic cancer survivors

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of proprioceptive exercises and isometric quadriceps exercises, combined with infrared radiation and kneading massage, on pain, joint stiffness, and physical difficulties in patients with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Proprioceptive exercises significantly reduced pain intensity and physical difficulties compared to isometric exercises, with both groups showing significant improvements over the study period. The combination of infrared radiation and kneading massage with exercises contributed to these outcomes.
population_specificity: Forty-five patients with a history of knee osteoarthritis.
effective_dosage: Kneading massage with methyl salicylate ointment, duration not specified; exercises lasted 10 minutes per session, twice a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of ice massage (IM) of the head and spine on heart rate variability (HRV) in healthy volunteers compared to tap water massage (TWM) and prone rest (PR).
results_summary: IM significantly reduced heart rate (HR) and improved HRV markers (RRI, RMSSD, NN50), indicating vagal dominance. TWM also reduced HR and increased RRI, while PR only increased RMSSD, with no significant differences between the sessions.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of long-term self-massage at the musculotendinous junction on hamstring extensibility, stiffness, stretch tolerance, and structural indices.
results_summary: The study found that long-term self-massage significantly increased hamstring extensibility by improving stretch tolerance but did not change hamstring stiffness or structural indices. Pain perception at maximum hip flexion angle remained unchanged in both groups.
population_specificity: Thirty-seven healthy men.
effective_dosage: 3 minutes daily, five times per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a comprehensive Ayurvedic program, including massage, could improve well-being compared to a standard vacation.
results_summary: The Ayurvedic program, which included massage, significantly improved spirituality, gratitude, and self-compassion, and reduced anxiety at follow-up compared to the vacation group.
population_specificity: 69 healthy adults (58 women, 11 men; mean age 53.6 ± 12 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of an integrative medicine education program, including massage, on reducing epidural use and improving labor outcomes in nulliparous women.
results_summary: The study found that the intervention, which included massage, significantly reduced epidural use, augmentation, caesarean section rates, and perineal trauma, while also improving newborn resuscitation outcomes.
population_specificity: 176 nulliparous women with low-risk pregnancies attending hospital-based antenatal clinics in Sydney, Australia.
effective_dosage: Not specified (part of a 2-day antenatal education program incorporating multiple techniques).
study_duration: 2-day program, with follow-up through labor and birth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether aromatherapy massage could alleviate agitation and depressive mood in individuals with dementia.
results_summary: The study found no significant overall changes in agitation for either group, but agitation decreased from Week 1 to Week 5 for the intervention group. Depressive symptoms significantly decreased over time for the intervention group compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Individuals with dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of craniosacral therapy versus classic massage on disability, pain intensity, quality of life, and mobility in patients with chronic nonspecific low back pain.
results_summary: Classic massage showed no statistically significant difference in disability (primary outcome) compared to craniosacral therapy, but craniosacral therapy demonstrated greater improvements in pain intensity, hemoglobin oxygen saturation, systolic blood pressure, and certain biochemical markers.
population_specificity: 64 patients with chronic nonspecific low back pain (mean age 50 ± 12 years, 66% female).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but outcomes were measured after treatment and at 1-month follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various treatments, including massage (electromechanical massage), for breast engorgement in lactating women.
results_summary: Electromechanical massage combined with pumping showed a decrease in breast temperature compared to manual methods, but the study had high attrition and bias risks. Another study found Gua-Sha therapy (a form of scraping massage) significantly reduced breast engorgement, pain, and discomfort compared to hot packs and massage.
population_specificity: Lactating women experiencing breast engorgement.
effective_dosage: Not specified for massage; Gua-Sha therapy was applied once (duration not detailed).
study_duration: Not specified for massage; Gua-Sha therapy effects were measured at 5 and 30 minutes post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of lymphatic drainage (LD) and traditional massage (TM) in reducing migraine frequency and analgesic intake in patients with migraine.
results_summary: Both LD and TM significantly reduced migraine attack frequency and days compared to the waiting group, with LD showing greater efficacy in reducing analgesic intake. The differences between LD and the waiting group were statistically significant, as were those between TM and the waiting group.
population_specificity: 64 patients (57 women, aged 45 ± 10 years) with migraine with and without aura.
study_duration: 8-week treatment period followed by a 4-week observation period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review literature on myofascial pain syndrome (MPS) and trigger points (TrPs), including exploring characteristics, clinical outcomes, and various treatment options such as massage.
results_summary: The abstract highlights multiple studies investigating TrPs, including their relationship with central sensitization and electrophysiological characteristics. Traditional Thai massage was among the treatment options explored, though specific efficacy results for massage alone were not detailed.
population_specificity: Subjects with myofascial pain syndrome and trigger points, including those with low back pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore whether recurrent musculoskeletal pain (RMP) in youth with cerebral palsy (CP) was associated with healthcare visits and to identify common pain relief measures, including massage.
results_summary: The study found that massage was one of the most common measures taken to relieve RMP in youth with CP, alongside rest, change of position, and oral drugs. However, the presence of RMP was not significantly associated with visits to healthcare providers unless pain severity increased.
population_specificity: Youth with cerebral palsy (mean age 16.5 years, 40 boys).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of curanderismo, a modality including massage, on chronic pain management in a patient receiving conventional treatment.
results_summary: The patient reported improved function, mood, sleep, and decreased narcotic usage, though quantitative pain measures showed no change. Curanderismo was associated with positive lifestyle changes and reduced opioid dependence.
population_specificity: An adult with chronic, opioid-dependent back pain post spinal fusion.
effective_dosage: 33 treatment sessions over 10 months (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the acute effects of Traditional Thai Massage (TTM) on cortisol levels, blood pressure, heart rate, and stress perception in students experiencing academic stress.
results_summary: Both the TTM and control groups showed significant reductions in cortisol levels and heart rate compared to baseline, but there were no significant differences between the groups. The study suggests further research is needed to explore other physiological effects of TTM on stress.
population_specificity: 36 physiotherapy students with self-perceived stress scores between 3 and 5.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the use, perceived effectiveness, and patterns of CAM (including massage) for cyclic perimenstrual pain and discomfort among adult women.
results_summary: Massage was widely used for cyclic perimenstrual pain and discomfort, with women reporting positive assessments of its efficacy, though most users self-prescribed without professional guidance.
population_specificity: Adult women experiencing cyclic perimenstrual pain and discomfort.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of massage as a nonoperative treatment for cervical radiculopathy.
results_summary: The study mentions massage as part of nonoperative treatment for cervical radiculopathy, suggesting it may help alleviate symptoms, but does not provide specific efficacy data or comparative outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with cervical radiculopathy, particularly those aged 50-54 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to rigorously assess the quality of evidence for massage therapy's efficacy in treating pain, function-related, and health-related quality of life outcomes in surgical pain populations.
results_summary: Massage therapy was found effective for treating pain (SMD = -0.79) and anxiety (SMD = -0.57) compared to active comparators, with weak recommendations suggested for its use in surgical patients.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgical procedures.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review nonsurgical treatment options, including massage, for chronic exertional compartment syndrome (CECS) of the lower leg.
results_summary: Massage was identified as one of four treatment options with little to no reported adverse effects, but the study did not provide specific efficacy data for massage compared to other treatments. The robustness of the data was limited by the study designs (case series and case reports).
population_specificity: Patients with chronic exertional compartment syndrome (CECS) of the lower leg.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the physical and psychological effects of Ayurveda-based head massage in the supine position.
results_summary: The study found that head massage increased parasympathetic nerve activity immediately after treatment, boosted freshness, and relieved anxiety, suggesting a relaxing and refreshing effect.
population_specificity: 24 healthy female students.
study_duration: Not specified (measurements taken immediately after treatment and over time).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to rigorously assess the quality of massage therapy research and its efficacy in treating pain, function-related outcomes, and health-related quality of life in cancer populations.
results_summary: Massage therapy was found effective for treating pain compared to no treatment and active comparators, and beneficial for fatigue and anxiety compared to active comparators. Weak recommendations were suggested for massage therapy compared to active comparators, but no recommendations were made for no treatment or sham control.
population_specificity: Cancer populations

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oil massage promotes physical and neurobehavioral growth in infants and evaluate its safety for infant skin.
results_summary: Oil massage improved infant weights, lengths, and head circumferences but did not significantly enhance neurobehavioral scores or cause notable adverse skin reactions.
population_specificity: Infants

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of acupuncture with other interventions, including massage, in reducing headache frequency for adults with tension-type headaches.
results_summary: The study found no significant superiority of acupuncture over massage, with some outcomes slightly favoring massage. However, the trials comparing acupuncture to massage were of low to moderate quality and inadequately reported.
population_specificity: Adults with episodic or chronic tension-type headaches.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of aromatherapy massage and reflexology on pain and fatigue in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: Both aromatherapy massage and reflexology significantly reduced pain and fatigue scores compared to the control group, with reflexology showing earlier reductions in symptoms.
population_specificity: 51 patients with rheumatoid arthritis recruited from a university hospital rheumatology clinic in Turkey.
effective_dosage: Aromatherapy massage (30 minutes, both knees) and reflexology (40 minutes, both feet) administered weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage-technique interventions in preventing or treating paternal mental illness during the perinatal period.
results_summary: Three out of the three massage-technique interventions reported significant effects on fathers' mental health outcomes, such as depression, anxiety, and stress. However, methodological limitations and variability in outcome measures made it difficult to assess overall effectiveness.
population_specificity: Fathers in the perinatal period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the treatment effects of naprapathic manual therapy (including massage) with and without spinal manipulation or stretching on pain intensity, disability, and perceived recovery in patients with neck and/or back pain.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in pain intensity, disability, or perceived recovery between treatments that included or excluded spinal manipulation or stretching over a 1-year follow-up, suggesting massage and other manual therapies had similar efficacy. Approximately 58-64% of patients reported clinically meaningful improvements in pain intensity, and 40-42% in disability, regardless of treatment variation.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-65 seeking care for back and/or neck pain at an educational clinic in Stockholm.
study_duration: 12 weeks (primary follow-up), with additional follow-up at 52 weeks

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the effectiveness of massage varies between stress responders and nonresponders when exposed to laboratory-induced stress.
results_summary: The study found that stress responders showed significant improvements in heart rate variability, salivary flow rate, and salivary IgA concentration, along with reductions in low-frequency HRV domains, compared to nonresponders after a 21-minute myofascial therapy session.
population_specificity: 30 Caucasian students with a mean age of 20.70 (SD 4.50) years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the potential of complementary alternative therapies, including massage, in treating rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that massage therapy, among other complementary therapies, has been proven for its capability in RA treatment, though specific results or mechanisms are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of early physical activity, including neonatal massage, in improving bone mineralization and reducing osteopenia of prematurity in preterm infants.
results_summary: The study found that combining passive range of motion, gentle joint compression, and adequate nutritional supplementation can reduce osteopenia of prematurity, suggesting the need for universal handling protocols for preterm infants.
population_specificity: Preterm infants at risk for osteopenia of prematurity and other metabolic bone diseases.
effective_dosage: Daily physical activity protocol (passive range of motion and gentle joint compression) combined with nutritional supplementation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the strength of evidence for Qigong therapy, including self-massage, in supportive cancer care and identify common constructs of effective protocols.
results_summary: Qigong therapy, which includes self-massage, showed positive effects on cancer-specific quality of life, fatigue, immune function, and cortisol levels in cancer patients. Effective protocols shared common constructs like gentle exercise, breath regulation, mindfulness, and relaxation.
population_specificity: Individuals with cancer in the USA, Australia, China, Hong Kong, and Malaysia.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the effectiveness of traditional conservative approaches, including digital massage, in treating central retinal artery occlusion.
results_summary: The abstract mentions traditional conservative approaches like digital massage but focuses primarily on hyperbaric oxygen therapy as the intervention that restored retinal perfusion and improved vision. No specific results for massage are provided.
population_specificity: Patient(s) with central retinal artery occlusion (specific details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether massage therapy could reduce pain and perceived fatigue in the quadriceps of athletes after completing an Ironman triathlon.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy significantly reduced pain and perceived fatigue compared to no intervention, as measured by visual analogue scales, but did not significantly affect pressure pain thresholds.
population_specificity: Seventy-four triathlon athletes who completed an Ironman race and reported pain in the anterior thigh.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess pressure ulcer characteristics, preventive measures (including massage), and treatment practices in Indonesian general hospitals.
results_summary: Massage was one of the frequently used preventive measures (35.2%), but the abstract does not detail its specific efficacy or outcomes compared to other interventions.
population_specificity: Adult patients with pressure ulcers in medical, surgical, specialised, and intensive care units across four Indonesian general hospitals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare confinement practices, including the use of massage therapy, among Chinese, Malay, and Indian mothers postpartum.
results_summary: Malay mothers tended to make greater use of massage therapy compared to Chinese and Indian mothers (p < 0.001). The study did not evaluate the specific effects or outcomes of massage therapy.
population_specificity: 1,220 postpartum women (57.2% Chinese, 25.5% Malay, 17.3% Indian) in Singapore.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effectiveness of massage and pneumatic compression on recovery from a 161-km ultramarathon.
results_summary: Massage provided immediate subjective benefits, reducing muscle pain and soreness post-treatment compared to supine rest. However, no extended subjective or functional benefits were observed beyond the immediate post-treatment period.
population_specificity: Runners who completed the 2015 161-km Western States Endurance Run.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of aroma foot massage on blood pressure, anxiety, and health-related quality of life in Japanese community-dwelling adults.
results_summary: Aroma foot massage significantly reduced systolic and diastolic blood pressure, state anxiety, and the proportion of participants with anxiety, while also showing a non-significant trend toward improving mental health-related quality of life. The change in systolic blood pressure positively correlated with the change in state anxiety among participants with relieved anxiety.
population_specificity: Japanese community-dwelling men and women (5 men, 52 women) aged 27 to 72.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effects of crenobalneotherapy, including massage, on knee osteoarthritis symptoms.
results_summary: The study found that spa therapies, including massage, improved symptoms in knee osteoarthritis, particularly for pain and function, though results on quality of life and drug consumption were conflicting.
population_specificity: Individuals with knee osteoarthritis in Europe and the Middle East.
study_duration: Effects were noted up to 3-9 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore patients' subjective experiences and perspectives on pain and wellbeing after an early nursing intervention involving "caring touch" (tactile massage and healing touch) following a motor vehicle accident with minor or no physical injuries.
