results_summary: Patients reported that caring touch facilitated trauma recovery by acting as a physical "anchor," alleviating pain, and improving wellbeing. Quantitative results showed significant reductions in pain (VAS) and post-traumatic stress (IES-R), along with improved health status (EQ-5D index) over 6 months.
population_specificity: Patients involved in motor vehicle accidents with minor or no physical injuries.
effective_dosage: Up to eight treatments with either tactile massage or healing touch.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify nurse and patient factors associated with inquiries about and referrals to CAM therapies, including massage.
results_summary: Nurses who self-reported using massage were more likely to ask about CAM use (OR, 2.20; P < .0001). Comfort discussing CAM and formal CAM education also increased the likelihood of CAM inquiries and referrals.
population_specificity: Oncology nurses and patients (699 patients, 175 nurses).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of spinal manipulation combined with massage versus massage alone on cervical spine range of motion, headache frequency, intensity, and disability in patients with tension-type headache (TTH).
results_summary: Both massage alone and massage combined with spinal manipulation significantly improved headache disability and cervical range of motion, but the combination showed greater benefits in upper cervical flexion and headache frequency reduction.
population_specificity: 105 subjects with tension-type headache (TTH).
effective_dosage: Four treatment sessions over four weeks.
study_duration: Four weeks of intervention, with follow-up at 8 weeks post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a perioperative educational program, including massage, could improve upper arm dysfunction in breast cancer patients following axillary lymph node dissection (ALND).
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant improvement in horizontal extension and subjective perception of post-operative functional impairment (SPOFIA score), while other secondary outcomes were similar between groups. The program may improve postoperative upper arm dysfunction and symptoms.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients who underwent ALND (64 patients, 37 in the intervention group and 27 in the control group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (massage was part of a broader perioperative educational program).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the evidence behind non-pharmacologic treatments, including massage therapy, for fibromyalgia.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that non-pharmacologic treatments, including massage therapy, are discussed, but specific results regarding massage's effects are not detailed.
population_specificity: Fibromyalgia patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the short-term efficacy of transregional interferential current therapy versus 'usual care' (massage, mobilization, and soft-tissue techniques) on pain perception and disability in chronic non-specific low back pain.
results_summary: The study found that interferential current therapy was significantly more effective than 'usual care' (including massage) in reducing pain and disability. The control group (receiving massage and other techniques) showed less improvement compared to the experimental group.
population_specificity: 64 individuals (20 men, 44 women) with chronic non-specific low back pain lasting more than three months, mean age 51 years.
effective_dosage: Up to 10 treatment sessions of 25 minutes each over two weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of connective tissue massage (CTM) and pilates exercises on pain, anxiety, and quality of life in women with fibromyalgia.
results_summary: CTM showed significant improvements in pain intensity, pain-pressure threshold, anxiety, and health-related quality of life, though the pilates group had greater improvements in pain-pressure threshold and anxiety reduction. Both interventions were beneficial, but exercise may offer additional advantages.
population_specificity: Women with fibromyalgia (n=22 in CTM group, 21 in pilates group).
effective_dosage: Three times per week for 4 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Tuina (a form of massage) and other Traditional Chinese Medicine therapies on symptoms and quality of life in cancer patients.
results_summary: Tuina showed a significant combined effect on improving quality of life in terminal cancer patients and relieved gastrointestinal discomfort, though the study noted a high risk of bias in many included trials.
population_specificity: Cancer patients, including those with terminal cancer and breast cancer survivors.

study_goal: To explore the potential benefits of incorporating massage into daily routine care for older individuals in residential care settings.
results_summary: Evidence suggests massage may improve pain, sleep, emotional status, and psychosocial health in older residents, while also reducing the need for restraints and pharmacological interventions. It can be integrated into care to enhance quality of life.
population_specificity: Older individuals (65+ years) in residential care settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of massage therapy on pain and range of motion in elderly individuals with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Massage therapy was effective in reducing pain and increasing range of motion, particularly when moderate pressure was applied and both the quadriceps and hamstrings were massaged. The results were consistent and clinically significant.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals with knee osteoarthritis.
effective_dosage: Moderate pressure massage targeting both quadriceps and hamstrings (specific frequency and duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of manual therapy (including massage) versus exercise therapy in improving postural hyperkyphosis in young adults.
results_summary: Both manual therapy and exercise therapy significantly reduced thoracic kyphosis angle and increased back extensor muscle strength, with no significant differences between the two treatments. Manual therapy was found to be as effective as exercise therapy for these outcomes.
population_specificity: 46 women aged 18-30 years with thoracic kyphosis diagnosed by flexicurve ruler.
effective_dosage: 15 sessions of manual therapy (including massage, mobilization, muscle energy, and myofascial release) over 5 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Touch Massage (TM) on anxiety, pain, sensorimotor function, and quality of life in stroke patients compared to a sham treatment.
results_summary: The study suggests TM may decrease anxiety and pain, improve health-related quality of life, and enhance sensorimotor function in stroke patients, though the field remains largely unexplored. The trial design includes blinded evaluations and multiple assessments to validate these effects.
population_specificity: Fifty patients admitted to stroke units with stroke-related impairments.
effective_dosage: Ten sessions of 30-minute treatments over two weeks.
study_duration: Two weeks of intervention with a two-month follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of slow-stroke back massage (SSBM) on the symptom cluster of pain, fatigue, and sleep disorders in adult acute leukemia patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: SSBM significantly reduced progressive sleep disorder, pain, and fatigue while improving sleep quality over time in leukemia patients. The intervention demonstrated clinically meaningful improvements in symptom management.
population_specificity: Adult patients with acute leukemia undergoing chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: 10 minutes of SSBM, 3 times a week (every other day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the feasibility, acceptability, and potential benefits of abdominal massage as an adjunct intervention for managing constipation in Parkinson's patients.
results_summary: The study found that abdominal massage was well-adhered to and acceptable, with 50% of participants continuing the practice post-intervention. Both groups showed symptom improvement, though no significant difference was observed between the massage and control groups.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease experiencing constipation.
study_duration: 6 weeks of intervention, with follow-up at 10 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of abdominal massage on constipation and quality of life in postoperative patients.
results_summary: The study found that abdominal massage significantly increased defecation frequency post-surgery, reduced constipation symptoms, and improved quality of life scores (PAC-QOL and EQ-5D) compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Postoperative patients diagnosed with constipation.
study_duration: Data collected on the fourth, fifth, and sixth days postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current updates and recent trends in labor pain management, including the role of massage as an alternative therapy.
results_summary: The abstract notes limited published data on massage for labor pain relief, suggesting its analgesic efficiency is inferior to standard pharmacotherapy but may serve as an adjuvant.
population_specificity: Laboring patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the effects of kangaroo care (KC) on breastfeeding outcomes in preterm infants compared to other interventions and explore how maternal-infant characteristics influenced these outcomes.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant differences in breastfeeding outcomes among the treatment groups (KC, ATVV, or standard care). However, mothers who practiced KC, regardless of group assignment, were more likely to provide their milk, and breastfeeding duration was greater among more educated women.
population_specificity: Racially diverse mothers (N = 231) and their preterm infants born weighing less than 1,750 g.
effective_dosage: Minimum of 3 times a week in the hospital and at home until infants reached age 2 months (adjusted for prematurity).
study_duration: Until infants reached age 2 months (adjusted for prematurity).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the available literature on the effects of conservative treatments, including massage therapy, on burn scars in adults.
results_summary: Massage therapy showed potential positive effects on scar pliability, pain, and pruritus, but the supporting evidence was less robust compared to other treatments like pressure and silicone therapy.
population_specificity: Adults with burn scars

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of uterine massage as part of the initial treatment for postpartum hemorrhage (PPH).
results_summary: Uterine massage is recommended as part of the initial treatment for PPH after vaginal delivery (Grade A). It is used alongside other interventions like oxytocin administration and manual uterine examination.
population_specificity: Postpartum women experiencing or at risk of postpartum hemorrhage.
effective_dosage: Not specified (performed as part of clinical protocol).
study_duration: Not specified (administered during acute PPH management).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the immediate effects of traditional Malay massage on pain, substance P levels, inflammatory mediators, and functional outcomes in low back pain patients.
results_summary: The study did not report specific results but proposed to measure changes in substance P, inflammatory mediators, pain intensity, and functional outcomes post-intervention. Previous studies on other massage types showed inconsistent findings on substance P levels.
population_specificity: Sixty-six patients with low back pain meeting inclusion criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of massage versus hypnosis in managing chronic pain in older hospitalized patients.
results_summary: Pain intensity decreased significantly after each massage session, but the hypnosis group showed a greater sustained reduction in average pain during hospitalization. There was no long-term pain relief observed in either group three months post-discharge.
population_specificity: Older hospitalized patients (mean age 80.6) with chronic pain lasting more than 3 months and no cognitive impairment.
study_duration: Duration of hospital stay (exact length not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of a massage intervention for improving sleep in hospitalized adolescent oncology patients.
results_summary: The study found that massage was feasible and well-received, with trends toward improved nighttime and overall sleep in the intervention group, though no significant differences in patient-reported outcomes like fatigue, mood, or anxiety were observed. Participant and parent feedback was positive, leading to the establishment of a clinical massage service at the hospital.
population_specificity: Hospitalized adolescents (ages 12-21) with cancer.
effective_dosage: One massage per night for two or three nights.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of back massage on anxiety, cortisol levels, blood pressure, pulse rate, and sleep quality in family caregivers of cancer patients.
results_summary: Back massage significantly reduced state anxiety, cortisol levels, systolic/diastolic blood pressure, and pulse rate while improving sleep quality in family caregivers of cancer patients.
population_specificity: Family caregivers of cancer patients (mostly women, married, secondary school-educated, and housewives).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review and meta-analyze the literature on massage for performance recovery to determine its efficacy and the conditions under which it is effective.
results_summary: The study found small and partly unclear effects of massage on performance recovery, with larger effects observed for short-term recovery (up to 10 min) and after high-intensity mixed exercise. Untrained subjects tended to benefit more than trained athletes.
population_specificity: Athletes and untrained subjects
effective_dosage: Shorter massage (5-12 min) showed larger effects than longer sessions (>12 min)
study_duration: Varied by study (short-term recovery up to 10 min vs. longer recovery periods >20 min)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect and safety of miniscalpel-needle (MSN) compared to controls, including massage, for reducing pain in myofascial pain syndrome (MPS).
results_summary: The review found that MSN showed potential benefits for MPS and was superior to controls like massage, though the included studies had methodological limitations such as high or unclear risk of bias. Further research is needed to determine optimal treatment frequency and session numbers for MSN.
population_specificity: Patients with myofascial pain syndrome (MPS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of sensory-targeted ankle rehabilitation strategies, including plantar massage, on patient- and clinician-oriented outcomes in individuals with chronic ankle instability (CAI).
results_summary: Plantar massage showed the most meaningful improvement in single-limb balance and improved patient-oriented outcomes, with the greatest effect observed at the 1-month follow-up.
population_specificity: Eighty patients with self-reported chronic ankle instability (CAI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a blended Infant Massage-Parenting Enhancement Program (IMPEP) improved maternal psychosocial health outcomes and maternal-infant interaction among substance-addicted mothers in outpatient rehabilitation.
results_summary: The IMPEP group showed significant improvements in parenting stress and depressive symptoms, but no meaningful differences in self-esteem, maternal attachment, or maternal-infant interaction compared to controls. Only the IMPEP group demonstrated improvements in both psychological and physical measures of parenting stress over time.
population_specificity: Substance-addicted mothers actively engaged in outpatient rehabilitation and their infants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review non-pharmacological strategies, including massage, for reducing anxiety in patients undergoing cardiac catheterization.
results_summary: Massage was identified as one of the strategies for reducing anxiety in cardiac catheterization patients, but the study did not specify its effectiveness compared to other methods or the optimal timing for its use.
population_specificity: Patients receiving cardiac catheterization.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the safety, suitable treatment regimen, and efficacy of masseter and temporal muscle massage using an oral rehabilitation robot for temporomandibular disorder (TMD) patients with myofascial pain.
results_summary: The study found no adverse events, established a suitable massage regimen (10 N pressure for 16 minutes), and reported effectiveness in 70.3% of patients, with reduced masseter muscle thickness in the therapy-effective group.
population_specificity: 41 TMD patients with myofascial pain (8 men, 33 women, median age: 46 years).
effective_dosage: Pressure of 10 N for 16 minutes, 5 sessions every 2 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of massage therapists within a multidisciplinary team for treating orthopedic injuries.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the varying training and licensing requirements among multidisciplinary team members, including massage therapists, but does not provide specific findings on massage's effects.
population_specificity: Orthopedic injury patients treated by a multidisciplinary team.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a self-management program, including abdominal massage, in alleviating antiemetic-induced constipation in breast cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The program significantly reduced constipation severity, decreased the likelihood of small stool volume, and improved mood states, with high patient satisfaction ratings.
population_specificity: Thirty breast cancer patients receiving 5HT3 receptor antagonists during chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (program included abdominal massage, stretching, and education).
study_duration: From before the first chemotherapy cycle until the day before the second cycle.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of Chinese hand massage in reducing anxiety among patients awaiting coronary angiography.
results_summary: Chinese hand massage significantly reduced anxiety scores compared to the control group, with no adverse events reported. No significant differences were found in blood pressure, heart rate, or quality of life between groups.
population_specificity: Patients awaiting coronary angiography in a single hospital in Fuzhou, China.

study_goal: To evaluate the effects of baby massage on transcutaneous bilirubin levels and stool frequency in healthy term newborns.
results_summary: The massage group had significantly lower transcutaneous bilirubin levels compared to the control group. Stool frequency was higher in the control group on the first day but similar between groups on subsequent days.
population_specificity: 50 healthy term newborns (25 in massage group, 25 in control group).
effective_dosage: Massage therapy according to Touch Therapy for four days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effectiveness of therapeutic breast massage in lactation (TBML) for managing engorgement, plugged ducts, and mastitis in breastfeeding women.
results_summary: TBML significantly reduced breast and nipple pain immediately after treatment, with 65% of women reporting the massage very helpful at 12 weeks. Most women also found the techniques useful for home management of future episodes.
population_specificity: Breastfeeding women presenting with engorgement, plugged ducts, or mastitis (n = 42 for TBML group; n = 73 for engorgement case-control).
study_duration: Immediate post-treatment effects assessed; follow-up surveys at 2 days, 2 weeks, and 12 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical management options for TMD pain, including the role of massage therapy as a conservative treatment.
results_summary: Massage therapy was identified as one of the most commonly reported conservative treatments for TMD pain, alongside occlusal splints, manual therapy, and other non-invasive methods. The authors concluded that conservative treatments like massage should be considered as first-choice therapy due to their low risk of side effects.
population_specificity: Individuals with temporomandibular disorders (TMD) experiencing pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of massage as part of conservative nonsurgical therapy for heel pain conditions.
results_summary: The study suggests that massage, along with rest, ice, correct exercise, and proper footwear, plays an important role in recovering from heel pain, though it emphasizes that suitable shoes are the most critical factor.
population_specificity: Individuals suffering from heel pain conditions such as plantar fasciitis, heel spurs, and Achilles tendinopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to gather evidence on the efficacy of healing touch massage, particularly for pain and other health outcomes in patients with malignant diseases, to support its integration into nursing practice.
results_summary: The study found positive effects of healing touch massage on pain, anxiety, fatigue, and biochemical parameters, with some evidence specifically in cancer patients. However, further research is needed to address limitations of previous studies.
population_specificity: Patients with malignant diseases (e.g., cancer).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the quality of reporting of statistical methods in randomized clinical trials (RCTs) of nonpharmacologic, noninterventional pain treatments, including massage.
results_summary: The study found deficiencies in reporting primary analyses, multiplicity adjustments, and missing data accommodations in RCTs of pain treatments, with only 62% identifying a primary outcome and 55% reporting methods to handle missing data.
population_specificity: Not specified (systematic review of RCTs published in pain-related journals between 2006-2013).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term effects and success determinants of cardiac pacing in patients with reflex syncope, using carotid sinus massage (CSM) as part of a diagnostic algorithm.
results_summary: The study found that cardiac pacing significantly reduced syncope recurrence rates at 3 years (20% vs. 43% in non-paced patients), with the greatest benefit observed in patients with negative tilt testing. The recurrence rate did not differ based on the initial diagnostic test (CSM, tilt testing, or ILR).
population_specificity: Patients aged >40 years with severe, unpredictable recurrent reflex syncope.
effective_dosage: Not specified (CSM was part of diagnostic testing, not a therapeutic intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of daily home-based facial exercises versus supervised rehabilitation (including massage) for postoperative facial dysfunction recovery after superficial parotidectomy.
results_summary: Both supervised rehabilitation (with massage) and home-based mirror exercises were equally effective for postoperative functional recovery in patients with facial paresis. The study found no significant difference in outcomes between the two approaches.
population_specificity: Patients (n=79, mean age 48 years) who underwent superficial parotidectomy with facial nerve dissection.
effective_dosage: Experimental group received weekly supervised sessions (including massage) and daily home exercises; slight paresis patients performed self-massage and mirror exercises.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of a single 10-minute session of Chinese head massage on cardiac autonomic nervous system activity, measured via heart rate variability (HRV).
results_summary: A 10-minute head massage session increased total HRV power (peaking at 10 minutes post-massage) and decreased heart rate compared to the control. The effects on high-frequency HRV were notable but not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 10 otherwise healthy adults (6 men, 4 women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of a definitive trial investigating the impact of topical oils (olive oil and sunflower oil) on neonatal skin and their potential contribution to childhood atopic eczema.
results_summary: Both oil groups showed significantly improved skin hydration but had less improvement in lipid lamellae structure compared to the no oil group. No significant differences were found in trans-epidermal water loss, skin pH, or clinical skin scores.
population_specificity: Healthy, full-term neonates (115 participants).
effective_dosage: Twice daily application of olive oil or sunflower oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Hoku point ice massage and music therapy in reducing labor pain severity.
results_summary: Hoku point ice massage significantly reduced labor pain compared to usual care, with effects similar to music therapy, though the difference between the two interventions was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 90 primiparous women expecting normal childbirth in Shahrekord, Iran.
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention applied at cervical dilations of 4, 6, and 8 cm).
study_duration: Duration of labor active phase (interventions applied at specific dilation points).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed the conservative management of nonneoplastic salivary gland disorders, including massage, and evaluated the role of sialendoscopy when conservative techniques fail.
results_summary: Massage was mentioned as part of conservative management for salivary gland disorders, but up to 40% of patients had inadequate response or persistent symptoms, leading to operative intervention in such cases.
population_specificity: Patients with nonneoplastic inflammatory disorders of the salivary glands (specifically the parotid gland).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide methodological guidance for clinical studies evaluating the therapeutic effects of TCM therapies, including Tuina (therapeutic massage), in combination with conventional therapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Massage's effects, as it focuses on outlining study design and reporting methods for TCM and integrative medicine research.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore non-pharmacological treatments, including massage, for reducing maternal stress and improving reproductive outcomes in pregnant women with a history of adverse pregnancy events.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that massage, as a non-pharmacological treatment, may be beneficial for pregnant women with a history of spontaneous abortion, preterm birth, or low-birth-weight infants by potentially reducing maternal stress and improving reproductive outcomes. However, no specific results or data on massage's effectiveness are provided.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with a history of spontaneous abortion, preterm birth, or low-birth-weight infants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of acupressure massage on pain and anxiety caused by venipuncture.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in pain scores between the acupressure, placebo, and control groups after intervention, suggesting acupressure may relieve venipuncture-related pain. No significant differences were observed in pulse rate or blood pressure among the groups.
population_specificity: 187 hospitalized patients in Khorramabad, Iran.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest aspects of massage therapy in current medicine, including its safety, efficacy, and acceptance among healthcare professionals.
results_summary: The abstract highlights massage therapy as a widely accepted and safe alternative medicine for conditions like arthritis, anxiety, sleep problems, pain management, and injury repair, though its role in modern medicine remains debated.
population_specificity: Patients suffering from varied pathological states (e.g., arthritis, anxiety, sleep problems, pain, injuries).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits of Traditional Chinese Medicine psycho-behavioral interventions, including Chinese massage, on improving quality of life in cancer patients.
results_summary: Therapeutic Chinese massage reduced time to flatulence and time to peristaltic sound in cancer patients, contributing to improved gastrointestinal function.
population_specificity: Cancer patients

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the effectiveness of relaxation techniques, including massage therapy, in reducing anxiety among antenatal mothers with pregnancy-induced hypertension.
results_summary: The study did not specifically evaluate massage therapy but suggested it as a potential complementary therapy for future research. The relaxation techniques used in the experimental group showed reduced anxiety compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Antenatal mothers with pregnancy-induced hypertension (PIH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of foot massage compared to routine prenatal care in reducing lower leg circumference in pregnant women with leg oedema.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in lower leg circumference between the foot massage group and the routine care group, suggesting foot massage did not notably improve oedema symptoms in this context.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with leg oedema (80 women in the foot massage trial).
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of daily foot massage for five consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of isometric massage on the recovery of hand function in patients with Colles fractures, specifically assessing finger flexor strength.
results_summary: Both groups showed significant improvement in global grip strength, but isometric massage did not provide additional benefits compared to standard physical therapy alone. Younger patients achieved greater gains in grip strength than older patients in both groups.
population_specificity: 40 patients with Colles fractures, divided into two groups of 20 each (Group A received isometric massage, Group B did not).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatment options for aspermia, including prostatic massage, and assess their effectiveness and suitability for individual patients.
results_summary: The study found insufficient data to make firm comparisons between treatment options, including prostatic massage, and emphasized the need for individualized treatment decisions based on factors like invasiveness and anticipated success.
population_specificity: Patients with ejaculatory dysfunction related to dry ejaculate (aspermia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, for improving sleep quality and reducing ICU stay in critically ill adults.
results_summary: The study found low-quality evidence suggesting that foot massage may provide small improvements in subjective sleep quality and quantity, but the effects were inconsistent and not strongly supported by robust data.
population_specificity: Critically ill adults (aged 18 and older) admitted to intensive care units (ICUs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Chinese massage therapy in improving gait parameters and reducing symptoms in women with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: The study found statistically significant improvements in knee pain relief, stiffness alleviation, physical function, gait speed, step width, and total support time percentage after Chinese massage therapy. No significant changes were observed in joint range of motion or initial contact angles during walking.
population_specificity: 20 women with knee osteoarthritis.

study_goal: To assess the impact of classic massage on blood pressure changes in women with previously diagnosed hypertension.
results_summary: Blood pressure values decreased over ten consecutive days, except for diastolic blood pressure measured 5 minutes post-massage. Classic massage may serve as a safe supportive measure in pharmacologic hypertension treatment.
population_specificity: Women aged 60-68 with diagnosed hypertension.
effective_dosage: Ten sessions of classic lower limb massage, conducted daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether stress reduction through touch massage (TM) affects blood plasma levels of endocannabinoids and related N-acylethanolamines.
results_summary: TM increased perceived pleasantness but did not significantly affect plasma endocannabinoid levels. Two lipids showed correlations between TM-related changes in levels and perceived pleasantness, but overall, no overt effects of TM on endocannabinoids were observed.
population_specificity: 20 healthy participants
study_duration: Two-session crossover design (specific duration not detailed)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the acute effect of rolling massage on pressure pain threshold (PPT) in individuals with tender spots in their plantar flexor muscles.
results_summary: Rolling massage (both heavy and contralateral) significantly increased PPT compared to control and sham groups at 30 seconds post-intervention, with effects lasting up to 15 minutes. Manual massage also showed a significant but smaller increase in PPT compared to control.
population_specificity: 150 participants with tender spots in their plantar flexor muscles (gastrocnemius or soleus).
effective_dosage: Not specified (interventions included heavy rolling massage, light stroking, and manual massage).
study_duration: Acute effects measured at 30 seconds and up to 15 minutes post-intervention.

study_goal: To determine the effects of Thai massage on muscle spasticity in young people with cerebral palsy.
results_summary: Thai massage significantly reduced muscle spasticity in participants, as measured by the Modified Ashworth Scale, with no adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Young people (aged 6-18 years) with spastic diplegia.
effective_dosage: 30-minute session of Thai massage applied to the lower back and lower limbs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of reflexology massage on pain relief after appendectomy.
results_summary: Reflexology massage significantly reduced pain intensity and methadone consumption in post-appendectomy patients compared to control and placebo groups. The intervention group showed notable differences in pain relief and lower analgesic use.
population_specificity: 105 post-appendectomy patients at a surgical emergency unit in Iran.
effective_dosage: Pressure on a defined area of the right foot for about 10 minutes and the Shen Men point of the ear for 1 minute.
study_duration: Immediate, 1 hour, 6 hours, and 24 hours after intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of clinical aromatherapy (specifically aroma hand massage therapy) for reducing behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia (BPSD) and improving activities of daily living (ADLs) in elderly patients with dementia.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant improvements in BPSD or ADL from the therapy, but qualitative data indicated positive experiences in mood, behavior, and communication. No harmful reactions or medication changes were reported.
population_specificity: Elderly patients (aged 65+) with mild-to-moderate dementia living in a nursing home in Japan.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of massage therapy, alone or combined with exercise therapy, for improving pain intensity and pain-related disability in individuals with subacute or long-lasting nonspecific neck pain over one year.
results_summary: The abstract describes the study protocol but does not report results, as the trial was ongoing at the time of publication.
population_specificity: Individuals with subacute or long-lasting nonspecific neck pain.
study_duration: Outcomes measured at 7, 12, 26, and 52 weeks after inclusion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of manipulation or mobilisation compared to other treatments, including massage, on pain, function, and quality of life in adults with neck pain or cervicogenic headache.
results_summary: For chronic cervicogenic headache, multiple sessions of cervical manipulation may be more effective than massage in improving pain and function at short/intermediate-term follow-up. However, cervical mobilisation alone may not differ from massage in improving pain, function, and quality of life for subacute and chronic neck pain.
population_specificity: Adults with acute, subacute, or chronic neck pain, with or without radicular symptoms, and cervicogenic headache.
study_duration: Varies by trial (immediate-, short-, intermediate-, and long-term follow-up)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of a single rhythmical massage intervention with either aroma oil or neutral oil compared to a sham massage on well-being and salivary cortisol in healthy adults exposed to stress.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant improvements in well-being or salivary cortisol levels between the rhythmical massage (with or without aroma oil) and sham massage groups. However, more participants in the massage groups described the intervention as "relaxing" compared to the sham group.
population_specificity: 118 healthy adults (mean age: 25.2 years).
effective_dosage: Single 60-minute massage intervention (including a 20-minute rest period).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of post-exercise massage on performance and recovery in male bodybuilders after intensive exercise.
results_summary: The massage group showed a better recovery rate compared to the control group, with improvements in performance and perceptual recovery, though both groups experienced significant decreases in performance metrics and increases in muscle soreness and creatine kinase levels.
population_specificity: Thirty experienced male bodybuilders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of mechanical massage and mental training programs, separately and combined, on employees' levels of anxiety, stress susceptibility, detachment, and social desirability during working hours.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences between the five groups for any traits studied, but individual groups showed positive effects: the massage group had reduced somatic trait anxiety, the massage and mental training group showed decreased stress susceptibility, and the pause group had increased detachment.
population_specificity: Employees from four different workplaces.
effective_dosage: Not specified (mechanical massage and/or mental training programs during working hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge on the mechanisms by which massage therapy (MT) reduces blood pressure (BP) and identify research gaps for future studies.
results_summary: The review identified six potential BP mediating pathways, suggesting MT may reduce BP through sympatholytic effects, improved hypothalamus-pituitary-adrenocortical axis function, and increased blood flow, but more rigorous studies are needed to confirm these mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of 27 publications)

study_goal: The researchers were not studying massage; they examined the long-term efficacy of miniscalpel-needle (MSN) release for chronic neck pain.
results_summary: The study did not evaluate massage; it found MSN release significantly improved pain and neck function at 12 months post-treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic neck pain receiving MSN release treatment.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (study did not involve massage).
study_duration: Weekly MSN release sessions (average 7 sessions, range 4-11).
